physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity was NLP in the right eye and count fingers in the left. Color vision was assessed with 0/11 plates on the right side and 2/11 on the left.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: One year after surgery, visual acuity was 20/400 in the right eye and 20/50 in the left, indicating improvement from previous findings.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity was count fingers in both eyes with color vision of 1/11 in each eye. Pupils were sluggish and there was no relative afferent pupillary defect.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Six months after surgery, visual acuity was 20/20 in both eyes with full color vision, showing significant improvement.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity was NLP in the right eye and 20/40 in the left. Pupillary examination showed a 4+ relative afferent pupillary defect in the right eye.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Six months after surgery, visual acuity was 20/60 in the right eye and 20/25 in the left with full color vision, indicating recovery.
